answers.answer: I'm no doctor, but I know antibiotics dont work at all for the pain.  I have used Azo (or the off-brand - its the same thing) before, and it helps tremendously!  I usually only have to take 1 or 2 pills total and im pain free.  I don't know if you can use it while using antibiotics, or with diabetes, but it's definitely worth a call to your doctor to ask.  Azo is not cheap, but its not too expensive either, and in my personal experience it works!

HiThanks for writing to the forum!Well, diabetes does delay healing and infection. Since your vagina is also swollen you can also be having some STD—is there a possibility? Also along with antibiotic you would need things like apple cider and vitamin C to combat irritation and itching. Take the course  for at least 5 days for full effect.Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

question: I am a 43 yo woman with diabetes.  I was diagnosed 2 days ago with a UTI.  My symptoms included a very painful urination (I would scream), a very swollen vagina, and unable to sit or stand for any length of time.  I have been on antibotics for 2 days with no improvement only now I do not urinate very often and it is very little and burns like gasoline.  HELP!  What should I do?
title: UTI or what?
